service_def.name: ManipulatorJointPositionsListDriver
service_def.description: The function of the Joint Positions List Driver is to perform closed-loop joint position control through a sequence of targets. The sequence of targets is specified by one or more SetElement messages, as defined by the List Manager Service. The \u201CSet Motion Profile\u201D message is used to set maximum velocity and acceleration rates for each of the variable joint parameters. All motions utilize the motion profile data that was most recently sent. Default settings are not assumed so that upon initialization this message must be sent before the first \u201CExecuteList\u201D message is sent.
service_def.assumptions: Messages may be delayed, lost, or reordered.

state.name: Receiving
state.interpretation: redefine state in order to extend

state.name: Ready
state.interpretation: redefine state in order to extend

state.name: NotControlled
state.interpretation: redefine state in order to extend

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a report manipulator specs message

guard.interpretation: True if a motion profile has already been received.

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Motion Profile message

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Active Element message

parameter.interpretation: enveloped query commanded Joint Positions message

guard.interpretation: True is a valid target position has been received.

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Commanded Joint Positions message

state.name: Controlled
state.interpretation: redefine state in order to extend

guard.interpretation: True if the message that triggered the transition is received from the client that is in control of this service AND True if the Element UID specified in the message that triggered the transition exists in the list AND True if a motion profile has already been received.

action.name: executeTargetList
action.interpretation: Begin sequential execution of the target list starting at the specified element.

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a report manipulator specs message

guard.interpretation: True if a motion profile has already been received.

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Motion Profile message

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Active Element message

parameter.interpretation: enveloped query commanded Joint Positions message

guard.interpretation: True is a valid target position has been received.

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Report Commanded Joint Positions message

guard.interpretation: True if the message that triggered the transition is received from the client that is in control of this service.

action.name: setMotionProfile
action.interpretation: Set the motion profile parameters for the manipulator.

guard.interpretation: True if the message that triggered the transition is received from the client that is in control of this service AND True if the resulting list will not be invalid as defined by the List Manager Service description and the receiving entity has sufficient memory to store the element(s) AND True if the message that triggered the transition contains payload(s) of valid serialized Set Joint Positions message(s).

action.name: setElement
action.interpretation: Store the given targets(s) in the target list with sequence specified by the previous and next element UIDs. If this action represents an insert or append into an existing list, the service should modify the NextUID of the previous element and/or the PreviousUID of the next element to reflect the updated sequence

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Confirm Element Request message

guard.interpretation: True if the message that triggered the transition is received from the client that is in control of this service AND the resulting list would be invalid as defined by the List Manager Service description or the receiving entity does not have sufficient memory to store the element(s)

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Reject Element Request message

guard.interpretation: True if the message that triggered the transition is received from the client that is in control of this service AND the message contains payload(s) that are not valid serialized Set Joint Positions message(s).

action.name: listManager.management.accessControl.events.transport.Send
action.interpretation: Send a Reject Element Request message
